 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָגַד‎</span>]<sub>363</sub> **verb** ==be conspicuous== (Late Hebrew in derivatives; Phoenician proper name, masculine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נגד‎</span>; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***conquer, overcome***, also ***be apparent, conspicuous***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***high land*** or ***country***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be courageous, vigorous, effective***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***courageous, efficient***; Aramaic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נְגַד‎</span> ***drag, draw, lead***; <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָגוֺדָא‎</span> ***leader***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***travel***); — 

**Hiph\`il**<sub>328</sub> ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִגִּיד‎</span> [[Gen.3.11|Gen 3:11]] +, 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִגִּ֫ידָה‎</span> [[1Sam.25.19|1Sam 25:19]] +, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִגַּדְתָּ‎</span> [[Gen.12.8|Gen 12:8]] +, etc.; ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַגִּיד‎</span> [[1Sam.9.6|1Sam 9:6]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּגֵּד‎</span> [[Gen.9.22|Gen 9:22]] +; suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַגִּידֶ֫הָ‎</span> [[Isa.44.7|Isa 44:7]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַגִּדָהּ‎</span> [[Jer.9.11|Jer 9:11]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יַגֵָּֽדְךָ‎</span> [[Deut.32.7|Deut 32:7]] (jussive), etc.; ***Imperative*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַגֵּד‎</span> [[2Sam.18.21|2Sam 18:21]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַגִּ֫ידָה‎</span> [[Gen.29.15|Gen 29:15]] +, etc.; ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַגֵּד‎</span> [[Judg.14.12|Judg 14:12]] + 2 t.; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַגֵּיד‎</span> [[Jer.36.16|Jer 36:16]] ***construct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְהַגִּיד‎</span> [[Gen.32.6|Gen 32:6]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לגיד‎</span> [[2Kgs.9.15|2Kgs 9:15]] [[BDB#Kt|Kt]]. ([[BDB#Qr|Qr]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְהַגּ‎</span>); ***Participle*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַגִּיד‎</span> [[Gen.41.24|Gen 41:24]] +; feminine <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַגֶּ֫דֶת‎</span> [[Esth.2.20|Esth 2:20]] plural construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַגִּידֵי‎</span> [[Judg.14.19|Judg 14:19]] — ***declare, tell*** [usually followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> of indirect object [[Gen.3.11|Gen 3:11]] + often; insert also [[1Sam.12.7|1Sam 12:7]]; [[2Sam.13.34|2Sam 13:34]] [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#The|Th]] [[BDB#We|We]] [[BDB#Klo|Klo]] [[BDB#Dr|Dr]] [[BDB#Kit|Kit]] [[BDB#Bu|Bu]], so [[BDB#HPS|HPS]] [[2Sam.13.34|2Sam 13:34]] ([[1Sam.12.7|1Sam 12:7]] he following HCT as more different); followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֶל‎</span> [[Exod.19.9|Exod 19:9]]; [[1Sam.3.15|1Sam 3:15]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לִפְנֵי‎</span> [[1Sam.17.31|1Sam 17:31]]; [[Ps.142.3|Ps 142:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַלפָּֿנָיו‎</span> [[Job.21.31|Job 21:31]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּאָזְנֵָי‎</span> [[Jer.36.20|Jer 36:20]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span> local (instead of indirect object) chiefly prophets [[Jer.4.5|Jer 4:5]]; [[Jer.5.20|Jer 5:20]]; [[Jer.31.10|Jer 31:10]] +; also [[1Sam.4.13|1Sam 4:13]]; [[2Sam.1.20|2Sam 1:20]]; [[2Kgs.9.15|2Kgs 9:15]]; [[Mic.1.10|Mic 1:10]] rarely followed by accusative of person [[2Sam.15.31|2Sam 15:31]] (but read <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וּלְדָוִד הִגִּיד‎</span> [[BDB#HPS|HPS]] (indefinite subject), or <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֻגַּד‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ולס‎</span> [[BDB#We|We]] [[BDB#Dr|Dr]] [[BDB#Kit|Kit]], [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Vg|ᵑ9]] [[BDB#The|Th]] [[BDB#Klo|Klo]] [[BDB#Bu|Bu]] favour <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֻגַּד‎</span>), [[2Kgs.7.9|2Kgs 7:9]]; [[2Kgs.7.11|2Kgs 7:11]]; [[Ezek.43.10|Ezek 43:10]]; [[Job.17.5|Job 17:5]]; [[Job.26.4|Job 26:4]]; [[Job.31.37|Job 31:37]] followed by direct object in accusative [[Gen.45.13|Gen 45:13]] + often; followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> [[Gen.3.11|Gen 3:11]] + often; followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲשֶׁר‎</span> = <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> (late) [[Esth.3.4|Esth 3:4]]; [[Esth.6.2|Esth 6:2]] followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָה‎</span> [[Gen.29.15|Gen 29:15]]; [[Judg.16.15|Judg 16:15]]; [[Esth.8.1|Esth 8:1]] +; followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מִי‎</span> [[2Kgs.6.11|2Kgs 6:11]] followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵיבָה‎</span> [[Song.1.7|Song 1:7]], once followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֲ‎</span> [[Gen.43.6|Gen 43:6]], etc.; often no direct object, followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֵאמֹר‎</span> [[Exod.13.8|Exod 13:8]]; [[1Sam.25.14|1Sam 25:14]] +; followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיּאֹמֶר‎</span> [[Gen.47.1|Gen 47:1]] +; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אמר‎</span> then following by ***oratio recta*** [direct speech]; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִגּ‎</span> alone followed by ***oratio recta*** [[Zech.9.12|Zech 9:12]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עַל‎</span> ***concerning***, [[1Sam.27.11|1Sam 27:11]]; [[Esth.6.2|Esth 6:2]] often indirect object omitted [[1Sam.24.19|1Sam 24:19]] +; direct object omitted [[Judg.13.10|Judg 13:10]] +; both omitted [[Lev.5.1|Lev 5:1]] + ]. In Hexateuch rarely [[BDB#P|P]], [[Lev.5.1|Lev 5:1]]; [[Lev.14.35|Lev 14:35]]; [[Exod.16.22|Exod 16:22]] ; [[BDB#J|J]], [[Gen.3.11|Gen 3:11]]; [[Gen.12.18|Gen 12:18]]; [[Exod.13.8|Exod 13:8]] + 18 t.; [[BDB#E|E]], [[Gen.21.6|Gen 21:6]]; [[Gen.31.20|Gen 31:20]]; [[Gen.41.25|Gen 41:25]] + 15 t.; [[BDB#D|D]], [[Deut.17.9|Deut 17:9]]; [[Deut.26.3|Deut 26:3]]; [[Deut.30.18|Deut 30:18]] + 5 t.; — 

**1.** ***tell, announce, report***, usually human subject [[Gen.9.22|Gen 9:22]]; [[Gen.24.23|Gen 24:23]]; [[Gen.32.6|Gen 32:6]]; [[Lev.14.35|Lev 14:35]]; [[Judg.13.6|Judg 13:6]]; [[1Sam.3.18|1Sam 3:18]]; [[1Kgs.1.23|1Kgs 1:23]]; [[Neh.2.12|Neh 2:12]]; [[Esth.2.10|Esth 2:10]] (twice in verse); [[Job.12.7|Job 12:7]]; [[Ps.142.3|Ps 142:3]]; [[Isa.19.12|Isa 19:12]]; [[Jer.5.20|Jer 5:20]]; [[Ezek.24.19|Ezek 24:19]] +. 

**2.** ***declare, make known, expound***, especially of something before not understood, concealed or mysterious, [[Gen.3.11|Gen 3:11]]; [[Gen.12.18|Gen 12:18]], etc.; [[1Kgs.10.3|1Kgs 10:3]] = [[2Chr.9.2|2Chr 9:2]] a riddle [[Judg.14.12|Judg 14:12]]; [[Judg.14.15|Judg 14:15]]; [[Judg.14.16|Judg 14:16]] (3 t. in verse); [[Judg.14.19|Judg 14:19]] dream [[Dan.2.2|Dan 2:2]] secret [[Job.11.6|Job 11:6]], etc.; of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> as revealing, [[Gen.41.25|Gen 41:25]]; [[2Sam.7.11|2Sam 7:11]]; [[2Kgs.4.27|2Kgs 4:27]]; [[Mic.6.8|Mic 6:8]]; [[Jer.42.3|Jer 42:3]]; [[Ps.147.19|Ps 147:19]] of declaring by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>'s agents [[Deut.5.5|Deut 5:5]]; [[Mic.3.8|Mic 3:8]]; [[1Sam.15.16|1Sam 15:16]]; [[2Sam.24.13|2Sam 24:13]]; [[Jer.50.28|Jer 50:28]]; [[Isa.58.1|Isa 58:1]] by divin. [[Hos.4.12|Hos 4:12]]. 

**3.** ***inform of*** (play the informer concerning) [[Josh.2.14|Josh 2:14]]; [[Josh.2.20|Josh 2:20]]; [[Jer.20.10|Jer 20:10]]; [[Job.17.5|Job 17:5]]; [[Lev.5.1|Lev 5:1]]; [[Prov.29.24|Prov 29:24]]. 

**4.** ***publish declare, proclaim***, especially of proclaiming wisdom, power, loving-kindness, etc., of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span> (especially Psalms): [[Ps.9.12|Ps 9:12]]; [[Ps.22.32|Ps 22:32]]; [[Ps.51.17|Ps 51:17]]; [[Ps.92.3|Ps 92:3]]; [[Ps.92.16|Ps 92:16]]; [[Ps.145.4|Ps 145:4]] +, subject heavens [[Ps.19.2|Ps 19:2]]; [[Ps.50.6|Ps 50:6]]; [[Ps.97.6|Ps 97:6]]; [[Isa.42.12|Isa 42:12]]; [[Isa.57.12|Isa 57:12]]. 

**5.** ***avow, acknowledge, confess:*** [[Isa.3.9|Isa 3:9]]; [[Ps.38.19|Ps 38:19]], compare [[Isa.48.6|Isa 48:6]]. — Participle = ***messenger*** [[2Sam.15.13|2Sam 15:13]]; [[Jer.51.31|Jer 51:31]] (twice in verse) compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַנַּ֫עַר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַמַּגִּיד‎</span> [[2Sam.1.5|2Sam 1:5]]; [[2Sam.1.6|2Sam 1:6]]; [[2Sam.1.13|2Sam 1:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הָאִישׁ הַמּ‎</span> [[2Sam.18.11|2Sam 18:11]]. **Hoph\`al** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֻגַּד‎</span> [[Josh.9.24|Josh 9:24]] +; ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיֻּגַּד‎</span> [[Gen.22.20|Gen 22:20]] +; ***Infinitive absolute*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֻגֵּד‎</span> [[Josh.9.24|Josh 9:24]]; [[Ruth.2.11|Ruth 2:11]] — ***be told, announced, reported***, always followed by<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לְ‎</span> (sometimes impersonal, logical subject in accusative, compare [[Gen.27.42|Gen 27:42]]; [[2Sam.21.11|2Sam 21:11]], with feminine [[Isa.21.2|Isa 21:2]] not in [[BDB#P|P]]): [[Gen.27.42|Gen 27:42]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), [[Gen.31.22|Gen 31:22]] ([[BDB#E|E]]), [[Deut.17.4|Deut 17:4]]; [[Josh.9.24|Josh 9:24]] (twice in verse) ([[BDB#D|D]]), [[Ruth.2.11|Ruth 2:11]] (twice in verse); [[Judg.9.25|Judg 9:25]]; [[2Sam.10.17|2Sam 10:17]]; [[2Sam.19.2|2Sam 19:2]]; [[2Sam.21.11|2Sam 21:11]]; [[2Sam.1.7|2Sam 1:7]]; [[2Sam.18.13|2Sam 18:13]]; [[2Sam.1.17|2Sam 1:17]]; [[2Sam.2.6|2Sam 2:6]];  [[2Sam.40.21|2Sam 40:21]] followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לֵאמֹר‎</span> [[Gen.22.20|Gen 22:20]]; [[Gen.38.13|Gen 38:13]]; [[Gen.13.24|Gen 13:24]] (all [[BDB#J|J]]), [[Josh.10.17|Josh 10:17]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]), [[1Sam.15.12|1Sam 15:12]]; [[1Sam.19.19|1Sam 19:19]]; [[2Sam.6.12|2Sam 6:12]]; [[1Kgs.1.51|1Kgs 1:51]]; [[2Kgs.6.13|2Kgs 6:13]]; [[2Kgs.8.7|2Kgs 8:7]]; [[Isa.7.2|Isa 7:2]] followed by clause with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎כִּי‎</span> [[Exod.14.5|Exod 14:5]] ([[BDB#J|J]]), [[Judg.9.47|Judg 9:47]]; [[Judg.1.7|Judg 1:7]]; [[Judg.23.13|Judg 23:13]]; [[Judg.27.4|Judg 27:4]]; [[Judg.1.29|Judg 1:29]]; [[Judg.29.41|Judg 29:41]].
